alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 5:02AM AKST until January 21 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING FROM KENAI TO ANCHOR POINT... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph during the morning. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will reduce visibility at times in the morning especially near the Inlet with gusty northeast winds. Snow will taper off and freezing rain will become more likely as the day goes on, but temperatures should rise to above freezing in the afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
